content.raw:
Wow, that is very thorough and should increase robustness a lot.

Please update \`NEWS\`.

If you are sure that part of \`segway-wrapper.sh\` is dead code, please remove it.

Using shared, non-temp observation files still works, right?
content.html:
Wow, that is very thorough and should increase robustness a lot.

Please update `NEWS`.

If you are sure that part of `segway-wrapper.sh` is dead code, please remove it.

Using shared, non-temp observation files still works, right?

pullrequest.title: Fix observation files being temporarly and securely created in segway task

content.raw:
Shared, non-temp observation files was removed and currently will throw a “NotImplementedError” from the earlier more-in-favour cmdline/minibatch changes. Ideally for fixed training regions \(not minibatch\), the non-temp observations would be used since they could be generated beforehand \(like it was originally\). Ideally for minibatch \(which is why this was changed in the first place\) temp files would be used since in the case of minibatch there’s a good chance if it runs long enough it’s going to write out the entire genome’s worth of observations.

I don’t think adding back in the pre-cached observation files would be difficult to add back in however.
content.html:
Shared, non-temp observation files was removed and currently will throw a “NotImplementedError” from the earlier more-in-favour cmdline/minibatch changes. Ideally for fixed training regions (not minibatch), the non-temp observations would be used since they could be generated beforehand (like it was originally). Ideally for minibatch (which is why this was changed in the first place) temp files would be used since in the case of minibatch there’s a good chance if it runs long enough it’s going to write out the entire genome’s worth of observations.

I don’t think adding back in the pre-cached observation files would be difficult to add back in however.

content.raw: Can’t delete the files \(here\) since they will be used by a child GMTK process after the files are created
content.html: Can’t delete the files (here) since they will be used by a child GMTK process after the files are created

pullrequest.title: Fix observation files being temporarly and securely created in segway task

content.raw: I believe in these cases that file deletion should only happen if the GMTK process has terminated or something exceptional has happened that requires cleanup
content.html: I believe in these cases that file deletion should only happen if the GMTK process has terminated or something exceptional has happened that requires cleanup

content.raw: What exceptions should be captured when attempting to delete files and what should be done in these cases? pullrequest.title: Fix observation files being temporarly and securely created in segway task

content.raw: So after some research del may or [may not actually cause the garbage collector to collec](http://effbot.org/pyfaq/why-doesnt-python-release-the-memory-when-i-delete-a-large-object.htm)t. I doubt numpy values are stored on the "free list". I've tried allocating a large numpy array of `zeros` and when `del` is used, the memory is released by the process back to the operating system. So I'm willing to bet that this `del` actually has an effect on segway-task's memory usage and should be kept in and used appropriately. To be extra sure we can call `gc.collect()` after the `del` to ensure memory has been released to the process and will give more memory to GMTK to run.
content.html: So after some research del may or may not actually cause the garbage collector to collect. I doubt numpy values are stored on the "free list". I've tried allocating a large numpy array of zeros and when del is used, the memory is released by the process back to the operating system. So I'm willing to bet that this del actually has an effect on segway-task's memory usage and should be kept in and used appropriately. To be extra sure we can call gc.collect() after the del to ensure memory has been released to the process and will give more memory to GMTK to run.

pullrequest.title: Fix observation files being temporarly and securely created in segway task

content.raw: OK. Get rid of the comment and add \`gc.collect\(\)\`.
content.html: OK. Get rid of the comment and add `gc.collect()`.
